decks.notes: The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. This deck aims to slow down the opponent's tempo and outvalue them with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Dreams of Steel and Oil and Psychic Frog to ensure you maintain control of the game. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful creatures, this deck aims to grind out your opponent and secure victory through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence with low-cost creatures like Scion of Draco, Wild Nacatl, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Nishoba Brawler. It utilizes a mix of counterspells like Stubborn Denial and removal spells like Lightning Bolt to control the board. Leyline Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact provide additional support for the creature-heavy strategy. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all five colors of mana for Tribal Flames.

The key concept of this deck is to use a combination of creatures and spells to quickly generate mana and disrupt the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to a win condition focused around Goblin Charbelcher. The deck aims to assemble pieces efficiently and effectively without relying on traditional land cards, allowing for a unique and powerful combo strategy in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Glimpse the Impossible to draw cards and deal damage. It also utilizes Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard and finish off opponents with cards like Grapeshot. The deck includes some card selection and recursion tools like Wish and Valakut Awakening to ensure consistency and adaptability in gameplay. The goal is to chain together spells efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through explosive combo turns.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying aggressive pressure. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt their hand and board, while deploying efficient threats like Recruiter of the Guard and Flickerwisp, the deck aims to control the game tempo. A key synergy comes from utilizing Ephemerate and Aether Vial to provide value and resiliency. With a mix of disruptive elements and powerful creatures, the deck looks to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a proactive manner.

This deck focuses on utilizing Jeskai Ascendancy to enable powerful combo interactions with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. By chaining together spells and activating abilities, the deck aims to generate a lethal combination of mana, card advantage, and board control to overwhelm opponents. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Unholy Heat helps to protect the combo pieces while maintaining a solid tempo advantage. With careful card selection and sequencing, the deck can quickly assemble its combo engine and dominate the game.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also providing ways to protect and recur its own threats. The deck utilizes creatures with powerful abilities like flicker effects, graveyard disruption, and removal spells to pressure the opponent and control the board. It aims to disrupt the opponent's resources while building its own board presence and steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. By efficiently using its creatures and spells, the deck aims to create a difficult board state for the opponent to navigate and ultimately come out on top.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to control the board with efficient removal and disruption while pressuring the opponent's life total with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler. Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration provide card advantage and selection, allowing the deck to maintain a consistent stream of threats and answers. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining tempo and applying pressure to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to play large threats like Primeval Titan and Cultivator Colossus. It utilizes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to accelerate its mana production and take advantage of land synergy. The deck's key strategy involves utilizing the Amulet Titan combo, which involves using Amulet of Vigor to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats and game-winning plays. It also includes cards like Explore and Scapeshift to help dig for combo pieces and secure victory.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana through land acceleration and Amulet of Vigor, allowing for explosive plays with Primeval Titan and Scapeshift to search for lands and combo off for a win condition. The deck utilizes the unique abilities of Urza's Saga and various bounce lands to generate mana and search for key pieces of the combo. The inclusion of cards like Aftermath Analyst and Cultivator Colossus provides additional utility and resilience to disruption, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to clear the way for damage. Utilizing synergies such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer's treasure tokens with Goblin Bombardment for extra reach, and leveraging Ajani's ability to buff creatures for a strong offense. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Static Prison and Extraction Specialist to control the board, making sure your creatures can hit face consistently for victory.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage. By using cards like Fatal Push, Lightning Bolt, Counterspell, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating value with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog. The inclusion of Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provides additional pressure and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game and out value the opponent in order to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently through cards like Mox Opal and Mox Amber while utilizing artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate additional value. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card advantage and recursion, while Jeskai Ascendancy acts as the primary combo piece, untapping creatures and providing powerful triggers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Repeal to control the board and protect the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the Jeskai Ascendancy combo to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Ral, Monsoon Mage, Ruby Medallion, and various mana-generating spells like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual to quickly cast and recast powerful spells. The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana, draw through the deck with cards like Valakut Awakening and Reckless Impulse, and ultimately win the game through a powerful combo involving Past in Flames and Wish. The deck also includes cards like Artist's Talent and Strike It Rich for additional value and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to enable powerful graveyard interactions, such as reanimating creatures like Griselbrand and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mox Amber for mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly put threats on the board and overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Asmoranomardicadaistinaculdacar help to recur key artifacts and maintain board presence. The deck also includes Mishra's Bauble for additional card draw and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to aggressively pressure the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and graveyard synergies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by planeswalkers like Teferi, Narset, and Jace. It utilizes powerful board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of the Skies to reset the battlefield when necessary. Isochron Scepter is used to reuse key instants like Orim's Chant and Prismatic Ending. The mana base includes various dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of different colors. The goal is to stall the opponent's game plan, disrupt their strategy, and eventually win through incremental advantage and superior late-game plays.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, backed up by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Tribal Flames. The deck also utilizes Leyline cards and Leyline Binding to control the board and protect your creatures. Additionally, Doorkeeper Thrull and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional utility and threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support a variety of colors for maximum flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent swiftly.

The deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing a diverse range of colors to maximize reach and flexibility. It aims to control the board early with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while also applying pressure with powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco. Tribal Flames serves as a versatile finisher, while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide protection and disruption. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the varied color requirements of the spells in the deck.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to play powerful land-based combos, specifically using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and Primeval Titan to search for key lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige. Utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Explore to accelerate land drops, the deck aims to set up explosive plays such as casting Scapeshift to search for multiple lands and trigger powerful effects like Valakut triggers for massive damage. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tolaria West to search for key spells and protect against counterspells.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures and using burn spells to control the opponent's board. The key strategy is to apply consistent pressure with low-cost creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride while using removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to clear the way for attacks. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage provide additional threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. The deck also includes cards like Voice of Victory and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's plans and protect your creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play efficient, low-cost creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, supported by burn spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional power and resilience to the deck. The deck also includes utility cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison to control the board and disrupt opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer to generate card advantage and maintain pressure. With a mix of powerful creatures, burn spells, and card advantage, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive strategy using efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By playing powerful cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury alongside aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison provide additional reach and disruption to help secure victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to maintain a fast pace of play, utilizing efficient creatures like Guide of Souls and Seasoned Pyromancer to apply early pressure, while also having access to removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt to clear the path for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional support and buffs for the team, ultimately aiming to finish the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Sink into Stupor to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having a board presence with creatures like Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to maintain control of the game until it can win through incremental advantage or a big threat like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The mana base is built to support the deck's requirements for different types of mana and to ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to bring out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with high-cost threats while keeping the board under control with various removal and disruption spells. It aims to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game through its powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruptive spells.

Utilize Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. Use cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while accelerating your own mana with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple. Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker provide big threats that can quickly close out the game, while Kozilek's Return and Devourer of Destiny offer additional removal options. The deck aims to control the board and dominate the late game with its Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with aggressive creatures like Hollow One, Vengevine, and Marauding Mako while leveraging cards like Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to fill the graveyard and enable powerful plays. The key strategy revolves around utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Detective's Phoenix to trigger graveyard synergies, while Ox of Agonas provides a way to refill the hand and keep up the pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy, using a combination of powerful creatures and graveyard manipulation to secure victory.

The deck focuses on using a variety of spells and creatures to create a powerful combo without relying on lands. It includes cards that manipulate the opponent's deck as well as counter spells to protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to assemble the necessary components quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. By utilizing a mix of control elements and explosive combos, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition without traditional land resources.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize powerful combo cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Lotus Bloom to quickly assemble a game-winning combination without relying on traditional land-based strategies. By utilizing a mix of disruptive counterspells and card draw, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo pieces to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. With the ability to generate a large amount of mana and play spells at instant speed, this deck can surprise opponents and win games out of nowhere.

The strategy of this deck is to quickly generate mana with cards like Ruby Medallion and Rituals, while using Ral, Monsoon Mage to draw cards and deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to set up a combo turn where it can cast multiple spells in a single turn, finishing off the opponent with a high storm count Grapeshot or Wish for lethal damage. The deck includes cards like Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames to reload the hand and continue the storm combo. The deck also includes some interaction with cards like Reckless Impulse and Wrenn's Resolve to help dig for combo pieces and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on milling the opponent's library as quickly and efficiently as possible through a combination of cards that force opponents to draw cards, mill cards from their library, and exile cards. It also includes disruption spells to control the opponent's board and graveyard. The main win condition is to deck the opponent out, making them draw from an empty library and lose the game. The deck aims to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy while steadily milling them down to victory.
